  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "DevOps Engineer (Cloud & Infrastructure Specialist)",
  "description": "Transnet Cloud (an AWS partner), is a dynamic and rapidly growing cloud technology company based in Nigeria, expanding its operations into other African countries. We provide cutting-edge cloud solutions to businesses of all sizes, empowering them to streamline operations, enhance efficiency, and drive growth. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and building strong, lasting partnerships.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer (Cloud &amp; Infrastructure Specialist)

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly skilled DevOps Engineer with a minimum of 3 years&rsquo; experience deploying and managing solutions on AWS and across multiple cloud providers.
	This role requires a hands-on engineer who can architect, implement, and maintain highly available and scalable cloud solutions while driving automation, security, and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines across AWS and other cloud providers.
	Implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or similar tools.
	Ensure robust monitoring, logging, and observability using AWS CloudWatch, ELK, Prometheus, or similar.
	Architect and maintain secure, scalable, and cost-optimized solutions.
	Automate operational processes including deployment, scaling, backups, and compliance checks.
	Collaborate with developers, architects, and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and delivery.
	Support high availability, disaster recovery, and incident response processes.
	Implement cloud security best practices including IAM, network segmentation, and encryption.
	Conduct performance tuning, troubleshooting, and optimization of cloud-native workloads.


The ideal candidate must hold at least two of the following AWS Professional or Specialty Certifications:


	AWS Certified Solutions Architect &ndash; Professional
	AWS Certified DevOps Engineer &ndash; Professional
	AWS Certified Security &ndash; Specialty
	AWS Certified Advanced Networking &ndash; Specialty
	AWS Certified Machine Learning &ndash; Specialty.


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, Cloud Engineer, or similar role.
	Certified in at least 2 AWS Professional or Specialty certifications listed above.
	Proven experience with multi-cloud deployments (AWS, Azure, GCP is a plus).
	Proficiency with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline).
	Strong experience with Linux/Unix systems administration.
	Experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS).
	Familiarity with networking concepts (VPC, VPN, Direct Connect, load balancers, DNS).
	Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell, or Go).
	Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks (SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR).
	Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.


Nice to Have:


	Experience in serverless architecture (AWS Lambda, API Gateway).
	Familiarity with big data and analytics solutions on AWS.
	Knowledge of cost-optimization strategies for cloud workloads.
	Exposure to machine learning or advanced networking solutions.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV &amp; copy of their AWS Professional / Specialty Certifications to:&nbsp;careers@transnetcloud.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

        Transnet Cloud (an AWS partner), is a dynamic and rapidly growing cloud technology company based in Nigeria, expanding its operations into other African countries. We provide cutting-edge cloud solutions to businesses of all sizes, empowering them to streamline operations, enhance efficiency, and drive growth. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and building strong, lasting partnerships.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer (Cloud & Infrastructure Specialist)

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role

	We are seeking a highly skilled DevOps Engineer with a minimum of 3 years’ experience deploying and managing solutions on AWS and across multiple cloud providers.
	This role requires a hands-on engineer who can architect, implement, and maintain highly available and scalable cloud solutions while driving automation, security, and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines across AWS and other cloud providers.
	Implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or similar tools.

	Architect and maintain secure, scalable, and cost-optimized solutions.

	Collaborate with developers, architects, and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and delivery.
	Support high availability, disaster recovery, and incident response processes.
	Implement cloud security best practices including IAM, network segmentation, and encryption.
	Conduct performance tuning, troubleshooting, and optimization of cloud-native workloads.


The ideal candidate must hold at least two of the following AWS Professional or Specialty Certifications:


	AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional
	AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional
	AWS Certified Security – Specialty
	AWS Certified Advanced Networking – Specialty
	AWS Certified Machine Learning – Specialty.


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, Cloud Engineer, or similar role.
	Certified in at least 2 AWS Professional or Specialty certifications listed above.
	Proven experience with multi-cloud deployments (AWS, Azure, GCP is a plus).
	Proficiency with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline).
	Strong experience with Linux/Unix systems administration.
	Experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS).
	Familiarity with networking concepts (VPC, VPN, Direct Connect, load balancers, DNS).

  "title": "Videographer",
  "description": "Softnation Homes Limited is a forward-thinking real estate development, marketing, and consultancy firm, dedicated to delivering luxury land and home solutions that fuse elegance, exclusivity, and strategic value. We exist to raise the bar in property living, optimizing spaces for discerning cosmopolitans who want more than just shelter, they want prestige, comfort, and a sound investment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a creative, skilled, and tech-savvy Videographer who can bring our brand story to life through captivating visual content.
	The ideal candidate must be able to shoot, edit, and produce high-quality property videos and lifestyle content, and must have hands-on experience with drone operations, camera gear, and mobile videography.
	You&rsquo;ll work closely with the marketing team to create premium content that enhances visibility, drives engagement, and converts viewers into clients.


Key Responsibilities


	Capture and edit high-quality videos of real estate properties, client testimonials, and lifestyle scenes.
	Operate drones safely and professionally to capture aerial footage of estates, buildings, and locations.
	Use professional cameras and smartphones to record promotional content for digital campaigns and social media.
	Develop creative video concepts and storytelling techniques that align with brand goals.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to plan video shoots, create scripts, and manage production timelines.
	Edit raw footage into engaging, cinematic final videos optimized for YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and other platforms.
	Manage video equipment, maintain file organization, and ensure consistent video quality.
	Stay updated with trends in real estate videography, drone shooting, and content marketing.


Education &amp; Qualifications


	Minimum of OND, HND, or B.Sc. in Mass Communication, Film Production, Media Studies, or related field.
	Professional certifications in Videography, Cinematography, or Drone Operation are added advantages.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 - 4 years&rsquo; proven experience as a videographer, preferably within the real estate, lifestyle, or corporate marketing sector.
	Portfolio showcasing real estate videos, drone shots, and social media content is required.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Proficiency in video editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve).
	Strong knowledge of drone operation, aerial photography, and footage stabilization.
	Skilled in camera handling, lighting techniques, and composition.
	Basic knowledge of sound design and color grading.
	Creative storytelling ability and attention to detail.
	Good understanding of social media content strategy (especially Instagram Reels, YouTube, and TikTok).
	Excellent time management and teamwork skills.


Other Requirements:


	Must reside within Ajah, Sangotedo, Abraham Adesanya, or Lekki-Axis for easy mobility.
	Must own or have access to a functional camera, drone, and editing system (preferred).
	Must be disciplined, reliable, and creative under pressure.
	Must be available for field shoots and occasional weekend assignments.
	Must have a strong creative portfolio (submit links or samples during application).


Remuneration &amp; Benefits


	Competitive salary -&nbsp;N150,000 - N200,000 monthly&nbsp;(based on skill and experience).
	Attractive project-based bonuses and performance incentives.
	Access to premium equipment and tech support.
	Opportunity for career growth within a creative marketing team.
	Exposure to luxury real estate projects and networking opportunities.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV to:&nbsp;emmanueltami7@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

title: Job Openings at Helean Global Limited
content:
Helean Global Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in Nigeria with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their businesses through our core services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Civil Engineer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Supervise civil construction of buildings, equipment foundations, silos, tanks, utility structures, roads, drains, and landscaping.
	Review and interpret civil and structural drawings, and coordinate with consultants for modifications.
	Prepare BOQs, material requirements, and ensure quality control of construction materials (concrete, steel, etc.).
	Prepare the AutoCAD drawing as per need basis.
	Monitor contractor performance, labor management, and daily site progress.
	Ensure civil works are completed as per engineering standards and project timelines.
	Coordinate with mechanical and electrical project teams for equipment erection and service trench alignments.
	Maintain site documentation, daily reports, and progress records.
	Ensure compliance with safety, health, and environmental standards on site.
	Assist in vendor/contractor evaluation and certification.
	Support project commissioning by completing all civil activities on time.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree / Diploma in Civil Engineering.
	5 years of experience in civil project execution in process industries
	Proficient in AutoCAD and MS Office.
	Knowledge of structural design, RCC, steel structures, foundation works, and industrial buildings.
	Strong site execution skills and ability to supervise contractors.


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@heleanglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Electrical Manager 

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Perform root cause analysis and troubleshooting of automation failures in PLCs, SCADA, sensors, transmitters, analyzers, and control loops.
	Manage preventive, predictive, and breakdown maintenance of electrical and automation equipment.
	Support PLC programming changes, interlock logic verification, and process optimization.
	Ensure reliable functioning of MCCs, PCCs, transformers, VFDs, and power distribution systems.
	Review electrical and PLC wiring diagrams, loop drawings, and SCADA architecture.
	Plan and maintain spares for automation hardware (PLC modules, transmitters, sensors, drives).
	Train and mentor maintenance technicians in automation fault diagnosis and safe electrical practices.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian statutory requirements and plant safety standards


 Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in any relevant field
	7 years of experience in electrical & instrumentation maintenance within edible refinery/solvent extraction / FMCG process industries
	Knowledge of AutoCAD to read and edit the engineering drawings.
	Must have experience in any of the following industries: Edible Refineries, Solvent Extraction Plants, Grain, food and breweries, FMCG.
	Exposure to gas power plants, DG sets, boilers’ control systems, WTP, ETP, and packaging line automation.


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@heleanglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Accounts Officer

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage day to day accounting operations
	Posts and processes journal entries to ensure all business transactions are recorded
	Coordinate the implementation of approved policies and process improvement initiatives
	Record accounts payable and accounts receivable
	Ensure monthly statutory employee deduction and remittance
	Assist in the preparation of monthly financial statements and other financial reports.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance or a related field
	3 - 5 years of finance experience in the FMCG sector
	Must be proficient in the use of SAP Success Factor or Tally ERP.


Application Closing Date: 15th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@heleanglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Interrand Homes & Properties Limited
content:
Interrand Homes & Properties Limited (subsidiary of Interrand Group) is a reputable Construction and Real Estate Development company with offices in Abuja, Lagos and Ibadan.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales and Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lugbe, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Real Estate

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Generate and convert leads into successful property sales
	Conduct market research and identify property investment opportunities
	Promote company products and services to potential clients
	Follow up with clients and maintain strong customer relationships
	Meet and exceed sales targets.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc in any field
	Previous experience in real estate or marketing is an advantage
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Goal-driven with a passion for property sales.


Benefits


	Competitive commission-based earning.
	Incentives and bonuses
	Professional training and support
	A great working environment with career growth opportunities.


Application Closing Date: 9th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: Lugbebranchinterrandhomesandpr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a reliable and experienced Driver to join our team. The ideal candidate should have excellent driving skills, a valid driver’s license, and a strong sense of responsibility.


Responsibilities


	Safely drive company staff, clients, and visitors as assigned.
	Maintain the vehicle in clean and good working condition.
	Ensure timely service, proper use of the vehicle, and adherence to road safety regulations.
	Keep accurate records of trips, mileage, and fuel consumption.
	Report any vehicle issues or maintenance needs promptly.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE or equivalent qualification.
	At least 4 years of proven driving experience.
	Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.
	Good knowledge of Abuja and its environs.
	MUST know how to drive a manual car
	Punctual, trustworthy, and disciplined.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a copy of their valid driver’s license to: hr@interrandgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Life Camp and its environs, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage front desk operations and attend to visitors/clients.
	Handle phone calls, emails, and inquiries professionally.
	Maintain office records and assist with administrative tasks.
	Provide excellent customer service and support to the team.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND or equivalent qualification with 2 - 7 years of work experience
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic computer operations.
	Must be well-organized, courteous, and punctual.
	Prior experience in a front desk/administrative role is an added advantage.
	Applicants must reside in Lifecamp or its immediate environs for proximity and easy accessibility.


Salary
Attractive and competitive.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr@interrandgroup.com using “Application for Front Desk Officer” as the subject of the mail.
